pros: Awesome Staff and management that are very helpful
cons: Not a lot of staff, but it is also a small hospital so it works!

pros: Good place to get experience, small town atmosphere, learn how to gain skills and wear many different hats, many lateral movement opportunities to broaden skill sets. Staff education department is fantastic. Decent benefits!
cons: Extremely low pay for pretty much every role at the hospital aside from CEO, CNO, CEO, COO contracted employees. Poor recognition of lower management. Poor use of time, meetings often don't result in progress. Penny and pound foolish... High turnover because of low pay... New grads get their experience and leave, and they have to retrain more new grads to take their places. Not competitive enough to maintain highly skilled employees who could be making double somewhere else. Most (except for the die hard) leave for better pay, though the employees generally like it here better, despite being often understaffed or with many contracted employees.

review_title: Small hospital of +/-400 employees with small  but tight knit IT Team.
job_title: IT Helpdesk Analyst in Healdsburg, CA
pros: Opportunity for an IT Generalist to perform a variety of tasks that would be unavailable in a larger environment. The hospital is currently being sold to a much larger organization that should enable it to survive well into the future.
cons: Current conditions (COVID-19) have caused management to eliminate positions from their small IT Team. The imminent sale of the hospital may/may not restore those positions. Uncertainty prevails.

pros:
Nice facility to allow those starting out in the health care industry.

Some of the staff treat each other well. Depends on the department/shift.
cons: A fair share of c-suite has been a mess for a while. The consultants/advisors that were overpaid were eventually booted. But the board needs to do more to hold upper and middle management accountable. It seems that the hospital could use an overhaul, both literally and metaphorically.

pros: Wonderful co-workers. More like a family than work, especially in the Sub-Acute Unit. We all try to work together and help each other out when needed. Many times help is just offered if others see you may be falling behind. Good benefits. Room for advancement. Does not pay as much as other places, but it makes up for the lack of pay with job experience. I could not have gotten the experience I have anyplace else.
Gain experience in the medical field! There are some great, friendly people here!
cons: Politics are thick and deep, there is a complete lack of job security, people quitting, resigning, or getting fired left and right. They failed the recent inspection from the state.

New management has eliminated many important people.  They did not evaluate the company when they arrived, rather they just compared this organization the last ones and arbitrarily decided to eliminate staff which has resulted in complete chaos.

pros: Family like environment, friendly staff who really care about the patients.
cons: Low pay, new management team is not invested in the staff or quality of care.

New CEO says you won't be fired if you tell her about the employee problem, she did not keep her word, you will be wrongfully terminated on your consideration of helping to improve this place.  I was bluntly lied to.

pros: I loved working with the patients and the employees
cons: I would of liked more CNA's to help out with the nurses and their patients.

review_title: I was in charge of 3 departments and provided direct patient  care for hospitalized and outpatients
job_title: Director Food and Environmental Service in Healdsburg, CA
pros: Good experience learning to manage 3 departments and provide direct pt care.Had to be very orgnaized.
cons: Lack of management support. Poor working conditions.Poor work life balance

pros: the pay and coworkers are great
cons: the long hours and odd shift changes.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Healdsburg, CA
pros:
Co-workers were nice
Schedule was flexible
Training was thorough
cons:
Low pay
Emotionally challenging work
Lacked communication

pros: small town feel, cut you teeth here
cons: really small budget to work with

review_title: It Used to be a Family
pros: Good people still work there (or did).
cons:
Upper Management is out of touch and not trusted.
People can't wait for the "contractors" to leave.
